p: For example, menthol administration is associated with an improved inflammatory profile and clinical manifestations in female patients with interstitial cystitis [ 113]. As for their cardiac effect, Avicenna wrote of watermint in his opus Canon of Medicine as a valuable herb for heart conditions, especially palpitations [ 114]. Recent research suggests that the Mentha x villosa species has a hypotensive effect through bradycardia and vasodilation [ 115]. Although several mint substances may display this vasoactive effect, it has definitely been detected in menthol [ 116].
